bill_section.title: Modernization of Healthcare Data Interoperability Standards
bill_section.statutory_location: Title II, Part B of the Public Health Service Act

statutory_language.primary_text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall promulgate regulations establishing technical standards for healthcare data interoperability thatâ€”
(1) utilize application programming interfaces (APIs) that meet or exceed standards established under section 3024 of the Public Health Service Act;
(2) require covered entities to provide real-time access to electronic health information through standardized APIs; and
(3) prohibit information blocking practices as defined in section 4004 of the 21st Century Cures Act.

definitions_section.definition: Any healthcare provider, health information exchange, or health information network that receives Federal financial assistance
Any practice that is likely to interfere with, prevent, or materially discourage access, exchange, or use of electronic health information

legal_rationale.constitutional_basis: Commerce Clause authority - interstate commerce in healthcare data
statutory_precedents: 21st Century Cures Act (P.L. 114-255) - Information blocking provisions
HIPAA Privacy Rule (45 CFR Parts 160, 164) - Health information access rights
ONC Interoperability Rule (45 CFR Part 170) - API requirements
legal_rationale.regulatory_alignment: Aligns with CMS Interoperability and Patient Access Final Rule (85 FR 25510)

implementation_notes.enforcement_mechanism: Civil monetary penalties administered by HHS Office of Inspector General
implementation_notes.effective_date: Phased implementation: 12 months for large entities, 24 months for small entities

stakeholder_considerations.provider_concerns: Potential burden of API implementation costs
stakeholder_considerations.patient_benefits: Increased access to personal health data via mobile applications
stakeholder_considerations.industry_alignment: Voluntary standards already adopted by major EHR vendors

flexibility_points: Implementation timeline may be adjusted based on stakeholder feedback
Small entity definition may require clarification
Enforcement mechanism details subject to negotiation
